result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas George Hanson Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment.
All financial obligations placed on payment plan $10 per month beginning 10/27/17.

Defendant is granted credit for time served as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department.
Granted Good Time.
Granted Work and Child Care Release.
Defendant is to contact the Ashland County Jail within 7 days to set up the date and time to begin serving his sentence.
  Def may serve in any Co in WI, provided def makes their own arrangements between the departments & at NO additional expense to Ashland Co.
Concurrent with: 15CF169 Counts 6 and 7 but CONSECUTIVE with 15CF169 couns 5,14,18 and 25

The Def is to provide a DNA specimen at the Ashland County Jail within 7 days.

Cash bond posted to be applied to the Defendant's child support obligations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas George Hanson in court with attorney Courtney J Latzig.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.15CF169 and 16CF41. Victim Kelly Nabozny appr by phone.  The document titled States Submission for Sentencing is the agreement of the parties. Charges/penalties read. Plea NC to 6 cts in 15CF169 and the sole count in 16CF41. Def stipulates to factual basis. Ct accepts pleas and finds him Guilty. State has complied with vic rights, no written response, Victim on phone statement. ADA comments on sentencing. Atty Latzig/Def comments on sentencing. 
Sentence of the court as requested in State's sentencing recommendation.
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Thomas George Hanson in court, in custody appear v/con  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def filed motion to file motion. Def comments during the first bail hearing thought he could come up with some cash. Now the cash is not available to him. Now has brother's car to he can get to court. Is not attending school this semester. Can start work as soon as he is released. ADA comments has prior record. wants cash bail, deny request. Ct agrees cash bail. Motion to modify is denied.
to Ct from def

Attorney Chris A. Gramstrup in court, defendant Thomas George Hanson not in court, in custody appears by video.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15cf169,16cf41. Atty comments 16cF41 will waive prelim. no threat or force to give up right to prelim. ct finds know and vol waive right to prelim. Ct finds prob cause def committed crime in Ashland CO. Will waive prelim in 15CF169 as well. Ct finds prob cause def committed crime in Ashland CO. both cases bound over for argnment. Info is not the same- DA has added 19 new counts, all felony non support charges. 16CF41 does remain the same. Atty comments does want to go into argment. Wiaves reading and enter NG plea 16CF41 and NG in 15CF169. Atty asking for STC.  Ct comments to def when def sends ct letters, ct takes no action besides sending copy's to atty's. Atty comments the letter is to address bail. Atty may appear by phone. Def now comments wants a new atty. Atty moves to withdraw. Ct approves to withdraw hearing.  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2017 at 09:15 am. Now has a ct date of 2/27/17 @ 1:15pm.. will not have March hearing.
to Ct from def

16CF41 and 15CF169 Defendant Thomas George Hanson in court.   RDK  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rec copy of each complaint.  Warrants in both cases canceled.  Lives in Ironwood, MI - attending school, lived there since Dece of 2015, atten at Gogebic College.  Not curre employed.  Can post modest bail.  State - ask for a sig cash bail due to previous history.  Ct ? defendant about how he got here - initially did not waive his extradition process, once understood process then he waived extradition.  Got into custody in MI Ironwood PD, knocked on door, and said had a warrant for him.  No charges pending anywhere else.  Curr unemployed.    Ct orders - Bail:  1000 cash bail to take care of both cases, cancel warrants.     Must make a personal appearance at that time unless still in custody then move to 1:15 p.m.  Can still leave State orf WI.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 23, 2017 at 10:30 am.
